body.p: Multilib is now forced on in the base 2005.0 profile. If you wish to have a pure-64bit system, you can use the 2005.0/no-multilib profile. This guide will show you how to upgrade a prior installation to a system that uses our new profile. There are two ways of upgrading: the easy and scripted way, or the longer way by hand.
We recommend using the upgrade script to make this process easier.
body.note: This script is not yet in place. It will be added once testing has been completed.

body.p: If you currently have USE=-multilib, you need to set multilib in USE and re-emerge gcc.
body.pre:
# nano /etc/make.conf remove -mutilib from USE flags
# emerge gcc If you get an error about not having a multilib sandbox, you need to set FEATURES=-sandbox # FEATURES=-sandbox emerge gcc
body.p: Additionally, you need to make sure you have the required versions of toolchain/portage packages as these are needed to properly rebuild glibc after switching the profile.

pre.caption: Ensure youu have a multilib toolchain

body.pre: # emerge -v --oneshot '>=sys-apps/portage-2.0.51-r9' # emerge -v --oneshot 'sys-apps/sandbox' Only if you are in ~amd64 # emerge -v --oneshot '>=sys-devel/gcc-config-1.3.9' # emerge -v --oneshot '>=sys-devel/distcc-2.18.3-r1' # emerge -v --oneshot '>=linux-headers-2.6.8.1-r4'
body.p: Next, make sure our 32bit glibc version is up to date. This version is needed to bootstrap the 32bit glibc build after the profile switch.
2005.0 doesn't use symlinks from /lib32 and /usr/lib32 to the emul directories, so we need to change them into directories and copy over some important files.
body.pre: # rm /lib32 /usr/lib32 # mkdir /lib32 /usr/lib32 # cp /emul/linux/x86/lib32/libsandbox.so /lib32 # cp /emul/linux/x86/usr/lib32/libc.so /usr/lib32 # cp /emul/linux/x86/usr/lib32/libpthread.so /usr/lib32 # cp /emul/linux/x86/usr/lib32/*crt*.o /usr/lib32 # env-update
body.p: Now, we need to make sure our baselayout is up to date, so we can gurantee /etc/env.d/04multilib exists.
We are now ready to actually switch the profile to 2005.0
Now just build glibc, unmerge the (obsolete) emul-linux-x86-glibc and update the base system.
body.pre: # emerge -v --oneshot '>=sys-libs/glibc-2.3.4.20041102' # emerge unmerge emul-linux-x86-glibc # emerge -upv system # emerge -uv system

body.p: Use this profile if you don't want any 32bit applications installed on your system. This means you won't be able to play x86 games, use openoffice-bin, mplayer-bin, mozilla-bin (flash), acroread, etc.
body.pre: # rm /etc/make.profile # ln -s /usr/portage/profiles/default-linux/amd64/2005.0/no-multilib /etc/make.profile # emerge -upv system # emerge -uv system
